title: The Goriest Fight Scenes from The Iliad, Pt. 2 - Clive Thompson - Medium

last_post.content:
It's National Poetry Month!

That means it's time to catalog ...

... the incredibly ghastly, bone-crunching deaths from *The Iliad*:

Severed spinal cords, punctured livers, eyeballs dangling from stalks, and heads rolling around like soccer balls

Yowsa

Last year I wrote a Medium essay entitled "The Goriest Fight Scenes from The Iliad, Pt. 1"

I've just published Pt. 2!

It's here: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-goriest-fight-scenes-from-the-iliad-pt-2-c75545ecd7d7

Here's a "friend" link in case you're not a Medium subscriber: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-goriest-fight-scenes-from-the-iliad-pt-2-c75545ecd7d7?sk=52259168fc76ad6ccb6d7b406b59a379

The third report on the R-spatial evolution project has been published. It links back to earlier blogs and presentations, and focusses on work that maintainers of R packages and workflows using rgdal, rgeos and maptools need to put in train now. The first changes will occur in June 2023, and the retiring packages will be archived during October 2023. If you are giving a workshop or tutorial during the Northern hemisphere summer, aim for June. #rspatial @rsbivand

title: What Happened When DataCamp Tried To Cover Up Its CEO’s Sexual Misconduct

last_post.content: Five years later, I still occasionally get pokes on LinkedIn saying, "Hey, you used to work at DataCamp, what can you tell me about them?" My response is, "Their CEO committed sexual assault, they tried to bury the story, he finally stepped aside after an outcry but returned while everyone was distracted by COVID." See https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/daveyalba/datacamp-sexual-harassment-metoo-tech-startup for @daveyalba's excellent summary from 2019 and https://third-bit.com/2019/04/15/an-exchange-with-datacamp/ for a personal addendum.

title: Do you actually need a vector database? | Ethan Rosenthal

last_post.content:
New blog post: Do you actually need a vector database?
https://www.ethanrosenthal.com/2023/04/10/nn-vs-ann/

To go along with the blog post, I made a small repo to benchmark using a "vector DB" (aka approximate nearest neighbors) with "brute-force" nearest neighbors https://github.com/EthanRosenthal/nn-vs-ann

The main takeaway is that the brute-force method takes ~50 milliseconds / 1 million embeddings on my computer, so hopefully those numbers can help you to make a decision on whether you need a vector DB!

title: Halving It All — Francine M. Deutsch

last_post.content:
When my wife told me she was pregnant 21 years ago, I went to the bookstore and bought three books. One book that caught my eye was Halving it All: How Equally Shared Parenting Works, by Francine Deutsch.

Today, on a visit to our kid, I was sitting in a cafe and overheard a woman tell someone over the phone that her name was Fran Deutsch. I had to introduce myself and tell her how much I got out of the book. It helped us to do a pretty good job of sharing parenting!
